publications.title: Deep Learning Approaches for Automated Medical Image Segmentation in Radiology
publications.abstract: This paper presents novel deep learning approaches for automated medical image segmentation in radiology, focusing on multi-organ segmentation in CT and MRI scans. Our method combines attention mechanisms with residual connections to achieve state-of-the-art performance on benchmark datasets while maintaining computational efficiency suitable for clinical deployment.

publications.title: Multi-Modal Learning for Early Disease Detection in Medical Imaging
publications.abstract: We propose a multi-modal learning framework that integrates imaging data with clinical records for early disease detection. The approach leverages cross-modal attention to identify subtle patterns indicative of disease onset, achieving significant improvements in early detection accuracy across multiple disease categories.

publications.title: Federated Learning Framework for Privacy-Preserving Healthcare AI
publications.venue: Medical Image Computing and Computer Assisted Intervention (MICCAI)
publications.abstract: This work introduces a comprehensive federated learning framework designed specifically for healthcare AI applications. Our approach addresses key challenges in medical data privacy while enabling collaborative model training across institutions, achieving comparable performance to centralized approaches without compromising patient privacy.

publications.title: Attention Mechanisms in Medical Image Analysis: A Comprehensive Survey
publications.abstract: This comprehensive survey examines the application of attention mechanisms in medical image analysis, covering spatial attention, channel attention, and self-attention approaches. We analyze over 200 papers published between 2017-2022, identifying key trends, challenges, and future research directions in this rapidly evolving field.
publications.notes: Survey paper, 150+ citations, Most Downloaded Article 2022
